entry.title: Tina Stege (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Tina Stege (pictured), who led the High Ambition Coalition at COP26, is from a country that may cease to exist with projected rises in sea level?

entry.title: Bernard B. Jacobs Theatre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Bernard B. Jacobs Theatre was known as the John Golden Theatre before the John Golden Theatre was?

entry.title: Sze-Piao Yang (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that pulmonologist Sze-Piao Yang was referred to as the "father of thoracic X-ray interpretation in Taiwan", and conducted the first ever occupational disease study done in Taiwan?

entry.title: Dragomino (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the board game Dragomino features "adorable" dragons?

entry.title: Nikolai Sachenko (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that violinist Nikolai Sachenko performs rarely-played piano trios by Russian composers as a member of the Brahms Trio?

entry.title: The Undercommons (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that The Undercommons, an essay collection that criticizes academia, was written by two alumni of Harvard University?

entry.title: Jonathan Strong (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jonathan Strong, an early enslaved West Indian in Britain, was abused by his master so badly that he could barely walk or see?

entry.title: a 1963 book (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a 1963 book offers Marxist and Freudian interpretations of Pooh?
